intro: Sideroxylon howeanum, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood that is highly valued for its durability and aesthetic appeal. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in yellowish-green cyathia. The tree is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of the Euphorbiaceae family.
